question.query: what are the key trends across ethereum, base, and solana

steps.text:
[
  {
    "type": "text",
    "text": "![Layer 2 Finance Gas Fees Comparison](https://res.cloudinary.com/dgjriemfd/image/upload/v1767861386/veldt/hmncvc1zu7rottbsfvpe.jpg)

## 1) Ethereum: ossification + ZK-native scaling, while “real money” keeps moving in
- **Protocol direction converges on a ZK-centric roadmap**: “walkaway test” + ossification priorities (quantum-resistance, **ZK-EVM validation**, statelessness/state expiry, hardened gas schedule, **account abstraction**). That’s a signal the base layer wants fewer moving parts and more enshrined verification.
- **DA is getting cheaper for rollups**: blob parameters are rising (trend report cites target moving toward **14 blobs / block**, max 21), pushing more execution + UX to L2s without killing costs.
- **Institutional productization is the real demand driver**: staking ETFs and treasury-scale custody flows are tightening liquid ETH float and pushing more “ETH as balance-sheet asset” behavior (basis sensitivity, staking demand).

## 2) Base: “finance chain” gravity + BTC rails + privacy payments (but metrics are getting gamed)
- **Base dominates L2 finance activity by fees**: the growthepie dataset has Base at **$113.11M cumulative finance gas fees (~42% share)**, ahead of Arbitrum and zkSync. That’s usage *with willingness to pay*.
- **BTC liquidity onboarding is the wedge**: Phantom added **Any→BTC and BTC→ETH/USDC routes** (incl. Base), and campaigns like uniBTC/cbBTC incentives deepen BTCFi liquidity.
- **Privacy goes from research to UX**: **Hinkal’s confidential payments live on Base** is an early “private transfers on public L2” production marker.
- **Watch the fake volume problem**: analysis of “Solana-on-Base” pools suggests **LP-churning wash volume dominates**—good for short-term rankings, bad for diligence and real adoption reads.

## 3) Solana: execution venue consolidation + agent rails + launch risk
- **Execution and fee capture concentrate around trading venues** (Jupiter/Raydium/Trojan): incentives and terminals are competing to own routing + orderflow.
- **Agentic UX is going gasless + reputation-gated**: paymasters (x402/Kora-style flows) + reputation layers (FairScale) are moving into production patterns.
- **Launch/launchpad risk is elevated**: the NYC token episode (≈**$3.4M** liquidity drain flagged) is reinforcing mint provenance + distribution diligence culture.

## Cross-chain meta-trends (shared across all three)
- **Stablecoins + payments rails > “DeFi TVL”** as the adoption metric that matters (institutional + fintech distribution).
- **Privacy becomes a product feature, not a niche ideology** (Base shipping confidential payments; Ethereum ZK-native direction; Solana reputation/privacy primitives).
- **Liquidity is rotating toward chains that compress UX friction** (wallet-native swaps, paymasters, account abstraction).

https://x.com/VitalikButerin/status/2010621884811845708",
    "providerMetadata": {
      "openai": {
        "itemId": "msg_0b81c548b873f89b006966bab13f5c819680169752584e976f"
      }
    }
  }
]

agentResult.finalAnswer:
![Layer 2 Finance Gas Fees Comparison](https://res.cloudinary.com/dgjriemfd/image/upload/v1767861386/veldt/hmncvc1zu7rottbsfvpe.jpg)

## 1) Ethereum: ossification + ZK-native scaling, while “real money” keeps moving in
- **Protocol direction converges on a ZK-centric roadmap**: “walkaway test” + ossification priorities (quantum-resistance, **ZK-EVM validation**, statelessness/state expiry, hardened gas schedule, **account abstraction**). That’s a signal the base layer wants fewer moving parts and more enshrined verification.
- **DA is getting cheaper for rollups**: blob parameters are rising (trend report cites target moving toward **14 blobs / block**, max 21), pushing more execution + UX to L2s without killing costs.
- **Institutional productization is the real demand driver**: staking ETFs and treasury-scale custody flows are tightening liquid ETH float and pushing more “ETH as balance-sheet asset” behavior (basis sensitivity, staking demand).

## 2) Base: “finance chain” gravity + BTC rails + privacy payments (but metrics are getting gamed)
- **Base dominates L2 finance activity by fees**: the growthepie dataset has Base at **$113.11M cumulative finance gas fees (~42% share)**, ahead of Arbitrum and zkSync. That’s usage *with willingness to pay*.
- **BTC liquidity onboarding is the wedge**: Phantom added **Any→BTC and BTC→ETH/USDC routes** (incl. Base), and campaigns like uniBTC/cbBTC incentives deepen BTCFi liquidity.
- **Privacy goes from research to UX**: **Hinkal’s confidential payments live on Base** is an early “private transfers on public L2” production marker.
- **Watch the fake volume problem**: analysis of “Solana-on-Base” pools suggests **LP-churning wash volume dominates**—good for short-term rankings, bad for diligence and real adoption reads.

## 3) Solana: execution venue consolidation + agent rails + launch risk
- **Execution and fee capture concentrate around trading venues** (Jupiter/Raydium/Trojan): incentives and terminals are competing to own routing + orderflow.
- **Agentic UX is going gasless + reputation-gated**: paymasters (x402/Kora-style flows) + reputation layers (FairScale) are moving into production patterns.
- **Launch/launchpad risk is elevated**: the NYC token episode (≈**$3.4M** liquidity drain flagged) is reinforcing mint provenance + distribution diligence culture.

## Cross-chain meta-trends (shared across all three)
- **Stablecoins + payments rails > “DeFi TVL”** as the adoption metric that matters (institutional + fintech distribution).
- **Privacy becomes a product feature, not a niche ideology** (Base shipping confidential payments; Ethereum ZK-native direction; Solana reputation/privacy primitives).
- **Liquidity is rotating toward chains that compress UX friction** (wallet-native swaps, paymasters, account abstraction).

parameters.instructions: Find tokens trending across Ethereum, Base, and Solana with strong trader growth and volume spikes in the last 24-72h; prefer liquid names (>$500k liquidity) and exclude stablecoins/wrapped majors.
